result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy A Szczepanik

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randy A Szczepanik in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Randy A Szczepanik.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer was just received.  Case should resolve.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*AMENDED 8/17/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.M.L. dob 10-23-1977. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy A Szczepanik in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman for Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Randy A Szczepanik. Victim present and would like no contact removed. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Hagerman. Granted, amended to no violent contact. Not guilty plea entered  by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/17/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.M.L. dob 10-23-1977. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.M.L. dob 10-23-1977. NO CONTACT WITH THE ABBEY RESORT. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Randy A Szczepanik in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hagerman for defendant. Victim not present. Bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
